pydantic_gen.main module¶

class pydantic_gen.main.SchemaGen(filename: Optional[Union[Path, str, None]] = None, yaml_content: Dict = None, code: str = None)¶

Bases: object

Main class of the program that does all the work. Once the code is generated the output is stored in SchemaGen.code property. You can choose to either save it to file with SchemaGen.to_file or import to sys with SchemaGen.to_sys

Example usage:

from pydantic_gen import SchemaGen

generated = SchemaGen('example.yml')

Once the code is generated you can save it to file:

generated.to_file('generated_schemas.py')

Or make it directly importable by adding to sys.modules:

generated.to_sys(module_name='generated_schemas')

After running generated.to_sys(module_name=’generated_schemas’ your code will be available for import:

import generated_schemas as gs
code: str = None¶
filename: Optional[Union[Path, str, None]] = None¶

print()¶

Prints the generated code.

to_file(filename: Union[pathlib.Path, str]) → None¶

Saves generated code to file.

Parameters

filename – Union[Path, str]

Returns

None

to_sys(module_name: str) → None¶

Saves generated code into sys.modules making the classes available for import.

Parameters

module_name – str : name of the module under which the code will be importable

Returns

None

Example:

from pydantic_gen import SchemaGen

generated = SchemaGen('example.yml')
generated.to_sys(module_name='generated_schemas')

After running generated.to_sys(module_name=’generated_schemas’ your code will be available for import:

import generated_schemas as gs
